text: On tap @ Fools Gold. This one has a really good looking cloudy honey orangey colored body with a tall and lasting eggshell colored really dense and nice looking head. On the nose its almost apple juice sweet. Lots of peachy sweetness, freshly hopped, a little stone fruits. Smells really nice. Tastes even better! . Man this stuff is superbly balanced. Its nice cloudy light and oily in the mouth, just above average on the prickling carbonation. So smooth. A little likely drinking velvet in the mouth this. Hoppy tones, a little clementine peel freshness. I could easily have a few of these anytime. Top stuff! 14.06.2017

Pours hazy gold into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Tropical fruit aromas. Soft with grapefruit, meadow and weed upfront turning to marshmallow before dry pith and resin in the lasting finish.

Draft at Blackback. Likely the last draft HF for awhile. Cloudy gold with rocky white head, great retention and lacing. Aroma: citrus, grass, herbs, some resin (though leans more citrus). Lean and hop-driven. Dry, moderate to assertive bitterness at end. Texture not as soft as Im coming to expect -- oily texture, average carbonation, light body. This has a bite to it. Overall: nice hoppy pale ale. Didnt see God, but what do you expect? Its just beer.

Tap at Hellcat Annies. Pours slightly opaque yellow. White head. Aroma is lemonade, orange juice, mango, tangerine, spot of basil perhaps? Juicy. Flavor is pine, lemon drop, tangerine, grass, floral. Juicy, sweet but piney finish. Enjoyable. Doesnt blow my mind (heresy though that may be), but it is very enjoyable.

On tap at Hill Farm. A yellow hazy liquid comes from the tap with a nice white head. Nose is very inviting, caramel malt, flowers, pine tree, it smells so fresh. Taste is caramel malt, pine resin, citrus, an APA I wish I could brew. The glass is empty in no time, it was very refreshing, well balanced, astonishing quality.

On tap at Whetstone Station in Brattleboro. Had one, then had another. Excellent, well balanced, easy drinking ale from a premier brewery. Rather than reiterate hundreds of comments about the attributes of this brew (color, aroma, palate, etc.) Im thinking about what makes this ale stand out... it is clean and crisp, complex in a subtle way, seductive and satisfying. Ive heard the phrase brewers art tossed around for years, but here it is. A masterpiece.

Tap at a market in DC
Pours slightly hazy lite orange hue with a small soapy white head. Nose is fruity pebbles slightly husky malt profile. Flavors are less hoppy than you would think. Nice tangerine rind and malt husks. Finish is short lingering dry malt profile and lingering lite bitterness. Very good but not as crazy as i was expecting.
More earthy and understated compared to some of Hills other beers but really well balanced and nuanced. Citrus, sweet bread, flower shop, lots of depth. Medium mouthfeel. Medium length finish.
Proletariat, NYC tap: pours orange with white head. Aroma is citrus, hints of pine, some flowers. Taste is fairly bitter, citrusy. Lingering aftertaste. Very juicy. Quite nice.
Great go to beer in VT. On draft. Pours medium hazy orange with minimal white head. Nice crisp hop aroma but somewhat subdued. Fantastic delicate flavor.

Keg at The Farmhouse, Burlington.  Cloudy golden, mid sized head. Passionfruit, grapefruit and starfruit up front. Bone dry with light-medium body and clean mouthfeel. Cucumber and starfruit, some pink grapefruit. Pleasantly dry, but a bit hard and edgy. Mid bitter finish. If there is any brewery usually living up to a hype it is HF. This beer however doesnt, yet it is pretty good.

On tap. Pours cloudy light yellow with a one-finger, white mostly lasting head that leaves good lacing. Light fresh aroma of grass, hay and citrus. Lightly bitter, lightly sweet, fairly dry body and finish, light to medium body, well balanced with a light touch. APA doesnt get any better.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #5 Mocna goryczka, świetny, świeży aromat.
Draft: Poured an orange with off white head. Aroma is light juicy hops. Taste is nice hoppy with very juiciness finish is alive.

On tap at the brewery. Poured a very hazy, opaque light yellow orange with a small white head. Aroma of pine and some faint bitter grapefruit. Taste follows, dominated by bitterness with a hint of pine. Searching yields some faint orange rind. Yeasty light mouthfeel. Slight biscuit in the finish. Clean with no off flavors but other than that did not stand out for me in any meaningful way.

Pours a hazy golden color with a thick white head. Nose of heavy citrus, grapefruit, tangerine. Taste is sour from the citrus with a medium bitter finish. It tastes like a fruity juice. Medium body. Excellent.

On tap at Torst, Brooklyn, New York, USA. A hazy light golden/ yellow coloured pour with a thin white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, orange aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, citrus, orange, slight pine. Quite a light APA but very pleasant and easy to drink.

On tap at Fools Gold. It pours a light orange color with a creamy off white head. The aroma is a little herbal with some weed and lime. The flavor has more orange tea, weed, some flowers, melon and citrusy lime. A little honey and graham cracker-like maltiness. Solid citrusy bitterness. Really nice.

Thanks Adam! Spectacular beer. Pours a muddy dull golden with a ton of foamy white head. Big aromas of fresh melon, bubblegum, biscuits. Flavours are similar. Grassy, bread, fresh melons, bubblegum. Dont know how a pale ale can get much better than this.

Tap. Cloudy dark peach meat hue. Fluffy white head. Creamsicle, pine, citrus hops in aromas. Flavor is much more woody, some slight white fruit, slight pine, drying but not grassy which is nice. Medium creamy soft body.

Tap at Bridgeview Tavern in Tarrytown, NY. Pours a hazy orange, with thick white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, mango, pineapple. Taste is super piney, pine resin, hints of orange and a bit of fruit. Nice strong bitter pale ale. Super smooth and clean mouthfeel. Awesome!

Draft sample. The beer is a moderately hazy orange with a white head of foam. The aroma has a strong orange meat and rind notes. Some vanilla, but major citrus. Dry. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Growler shared by jc1762. Thanks Jon! I thought I had had this one before - I may have and I might have just not rated the beer. Anyway... this one poured a really hazy, cloudy light orange color with a small white head. Aroma was blast of grapefruit zest, very light sweet malt notes. Flavor was nice, zest, light tropical fruit. Pretty tasty.

Tap into a nonic pint showing unfiltered dark orange with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows subtle and mild grapefruit with light malts. 

The palate is medium bodied and fully carbonated. Flavors of very light grapefruit and subtle malt into a mid-palate of light citric acidity. The finish shows a light grapefruit zesty bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2016 On tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Pours hazy golden, white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit, citrus, caramel malty, piney. Sweetish, dry and lasting bitter finish. Medium bodied. Great.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Pours a hazy gold with a large dense white head and some lace. Aroma of grapefruit, moderate pine, leafy, floral, subtle orange/lemon zest and tropical fruit, just a little malt sweetness and bread beneath. Flavour is pine, grapefruit and lemon peels, leafy, slightly floral, a bit juicy, subtle bready malt core. Lightly sweet to begin, finishing dry with lasting moderate bitterness, pine/leafy/floral aftertaste. Medium bodied, average carbonation, fairly crisp. Good balance in general, a touch on the bitter side for a more modern east coast APA but a very good drinker.

On tap at Hill farmstead brewing. Pours out a golden topped with a small head. Nose is citrus pine some tropical hops notes and a light malty sweetness. Taste is more of the hop mix citrus pine some grass and a nice malt balance.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2017 Draught. Pours a cloudy orange with a large white head. Aroma of citrus and straw. Taste is bready with citrus, floral hops, light pine, and just a hint of maltiness. Complex taste but a little too quiet. Very slight bitterness on the finish. Light carbonation. Medium-bodied with a creamy, heavy mouthfeel.

Draft at anchorage brewing, hazy light Amber beer creamy white head. Aroma malt, faint citrus. Taste is malt, resin, grapefruit rind. Palate is light, carbonation average. This leans towards malty side of apa.

Pours a cloudy bright orange with thick white head. Has a strong floral hop and citrus aroma. A strong flavor of citrus and floral hops, pine, grains and light spices. And lingering citrus and light bitter hop aftertaste.

Creamy hazy golden pour on draft. Citrus slightly barnyard hay aroma. Taste is bright and citrusy with a light funk. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Doc Ponds. Pours super hazy milky orange with thick white head that fades quickly and laces heavily. Aroma is clean, dry pale malt; faint citrus and fresh grassy hops. Taste is likewise - super clean pale malt; juicy hops with just a hint of citrus, lightly dank on the back before fading to a clean finish. Incredibly simple and well-balanced, this isnt overwhelming, just dialed.
CBC 2016 Yellow session.Hazy golden body with a white head. Aroma of resin, citrus, grape fruit, orange. Taste is bitter and dry, fresh and hoppy, tropical and zesty. Smooth and crisp, excellent.

Pint on tap. Hazy golden orange pour, finger of white head. Tropical citrus, a bit of pine, aromatic and flowery, pretty busy and pleasant. Juicy flavour with a slight hint of pineapple and slight maltiness. A gorgeous monster; very tasty, worthy of the hype.

Growler from Brewery: This one pours a hazy golden color. There was a bit of an off white head on it that leaves some lacing. The nose is good. Citrus, pine, some grassiness, spiciness and maybe a hint of pineapple. The taste is very good. Just a bit of bitterness. Pine, pineapple, citrus, faint spices. Subtle but a lot going on in there. Definitely a very good brew.

On tap at Armsby Abbey. Pours a cloudy golden color with a fluffy two finger head. Nose has subtle hop aroma, which makes the taste even that more amazing. Juicing grapefruit and pineapple with a very nice balance between slight malt forward on the front and slightly bitter on the finish. Very nice!
On tap at The Ginger Man thanks to puzzl. Poured gold with white head. Aroma good citrus and malt balance. Light carb med bod. Taste again balanced malty light bitter.

750ml bottle, purchased at the brewery, slight hazy honey gold hue, with a white head, nice fresh squeezed lemon, orange rind, floral citrus, leafy, grassy hoppy nose, with some panettone cake dough, lemon pie crust, faint pine needles accents, and a fruity yeast, light doughy, subtle pinneapple cake note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with fruity yeasty, juicy citrus peel, a good flowery citrus, leafy, grassy, piney hoppy character with some zesty lemon rind, lemon pie, lemon tea leaf, cedary flavours, leading towards a yeasty, lemon, leafy, minty, grassy, piney hop bitterness finish.

On tap at Whetstoner with Patty. Pours cloudy orange with a one finger white head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of fresh citrus, juicy tropical fruits, pine, grassy hops, melon, light bready malts, herbs, and dank hops. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a super creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long finish. Overall, a super tasty and enjoyable!

Flight at The Belly with koleminer20. Aroma is floral, tropical fruit, juicy, pine. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, off white head. Taste is pine, flora,l tropical fruit, juicy, dry. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, nice floral pine aftertaste. Overall, this one is pretty good.
Tap. Hazy gold with a foamy white head that lasts in a ring and laces. Aromas of grapefruit, pine, yeast and mango. Flavor is the same with a light spice. Light plus bodied, smooth with a dry end.

Flight at armsby abbey. Pours golden with a thin white head. Leafy and piney on the nose. Nice and hoppy on the tongue. Finished clean without a ton of bitterness. Nice example of the style!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

Hazy golden colour with a small white creamy head. Aroma is fruity, floral and zesty with some sweet malts as well as some toffee to it. Flavour is zesty, fruity, floral, quite dry and nicely bitter in the finish. Nicely tart as well.
In the glass it has amber color with a nice head. Aroma of pineapple, apricot and a touch of lemon. Taste has a mild balance of fruits, malts and some bread. Well balanced beer with a good finish.
Augur Wells, NYC. Cloudy brown-orange, good lacing foam. Tangerine-grapefruit aroma. Sweet hop. Medium body. Pretty delicious.

Draft at Bru Craft. Cloudy yellow orange pour with soft white foam. Not much aroma. Tannic orange juice. Good dose of citrus resins. Bitter blonde caramel marmalade. Pineapple. Lemongrass. Fuller body than expected. Broadens nicely as it warms. Well balanced. Manages to both bring in and counter some dank grassy hops.
Looks pretty amazing, especially in a darker bar. Nice hoppy nose. First Hill Farmstead beer and I was pretty happy with it.

Served on tap at Farmhouse tap & grill. Hazy orange color with a white head. Citrus orange aroma. Orange citrus upfront with a mild hops finish. Medium body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Prohibition Pig near Waterbury, VT. Half pint. ECBT Crew present. Deeper orange and golden color with an unfiltered haze. Cloudy. Nice half finger head. Aroma is citrus fun the hops with a healthy dose of pine. Taste is mostly bitter with an oily, resin like mouthfeel. Nice blend of tropical and citrus fruits. Bitterness dominates the palette towards the finish. First beer from this brewery for me and its definitely good. Edward is a solid, reliable dude.

Tap at prohibition pig with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Hazy yellow orange with medium white head. Clean citrus nose. Smooth, strong citrus bite, really nice hop bitterness, fresh. Just a little bit of oiliness . First hill farmstead for me, and happy that its for 950. .

Tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy blonde with a big white head. Notes of honey and white grape. A sweetness to the taste that is surprisingly not backed up with too much bitterness. Quite buttery malts with herbal hops. Not quite what I was expecting from this.

On tap at Rattle N Hum West, NYC. I assume this sample wasnt on top form because I appear to have had a different experience of this beer than everyone else. Cloudy, murky colour; unfiltered but should still be dropping clearer than this. Muddled taste, not overly bitter. Hint of funk. Given the name I assumed it was an attempt at a farmhouse IPA or some such; sanitation issue somewhere along the chain? Id try it again and re-assess, if someone gave me one.

From tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow color with white head. Light malty and hoppy aroma, floral, citrusy fruity, lemon. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

On tap outside at WarPigs Brewpub during Hill Farmstead Day, kindly shared by KimJohansen. Lacing to the upper part of the glass. Low white head resting on top of a hazy golden body. Floral and fruity smell, mid-sweet. Freshly hopped taste of tropical and juicy fruits. Sharp fruity bitterness to the aftertaste, long-lived. Well bodied. Enjoying apa (Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Cloudy with a thin head. Floral, melony and a touch citrusy..appetizing nose. Bitter, quite, with a bit of sweet pale malt in the finish. But a touch of yeastiness and more important the hop bitterness is a bit towards the harsh side.
On tap at Warpigs, pre-CBC. Pale orange. Bitter, with notes of pine, citrus and tropical fruit hops.

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, mango, some pine and light malt. Fresh and with a bitter finish. Tasty.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Sample CBC-16, Copenhagen 14/5-16. Fruity and hoppy with sorachi ace and citrus. Dry, fruity and hoppy finish.
Sample @ cbc 2016. Pours a light hazy golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity with some funk and yeast. Dry finish

Draught @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Light hazy deep golden liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, mango, floral hops, perfume, grain and light red berries. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, mango and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Super nice! Maybe a bit overly bitter for the style.

On tap at CBC 16. Pours a hazy golden with a big white head and lacings. Quite bitter with hoppy aromas of spruce and pine.Medium to light bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Long and very bitter finish.
Cloudy orange, small white head. Aroma has orange and biscuits. Malty flavour with aome sourish orange.
Tap@ warpigs. Hazy golden, thick white head. Tropical fruity hoppy aroma. Floral, pineapples. Fruity, balancing sweetness, floral flavors. Good stuff, juicy lingering finish.

Malty slight huskey nose. Some florals, citrus, pine foresty. Med lightish body, good bitters, bit dry finish. Sort of soft nice though, some thinness. Perfectly nice apa. Isnt amazing tho. Still, great balance for this.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy golden pour with a generous head. Juicy hops, mandarin, some stone fruit, smooth a light bitterness. Good!

Pours cloudy yellow with medium white head. Amazing tropical fruits nose. Armas are citrus, tropical fruits (lychee, mango) and piney hops. Average carbonation, light body. Long bitter, dry and resinous finish. Very nice and enjoyable American pale ale! Great surprise!
Draught @ Fools Gold. A Hoppy punch of orange peel and citrus. Light and soft mouthfeel. Small dryness in the end.

Ce soir, je mela joue grand classique rapporté en growler de mon voyage dhier. Dès le bouchon de céramique sauté, je suis envahi par cet arôme unique qui me plaît tant lorsque jentre au bottle shop de la brasserie de la colline. Les arômes dEdward ce sont les arômes du petit kit de brassage; celui que Shaun utilisait avant lexpansion de la brasserie. Ça ne me dérangeait même pas dattendre 3 heures dans linterminable file des growlers, car y être, cétait dapprécier lendroit pour ses arômes et pour ce sentiment de paix que je ressentais lorsque jy étais. Edward me fait revivre ces moments pour une nième fois ce soir. En rêvassant à ces vieux souvenirs, je me surprends à téter ce liquide à la manière dun bébé agrippé à la mamelle nourricière. Je nen dis pas plus, je préfère me taire et déguster cette grande parmi les Grandes, les yeux fermés et le coeur léger.

From Tap: peach-like golden orange color, thick white head, very fruity nose, citrus, mango, berries, big creamy mouthfeel, low seetness, bitter hoppy finish, some pine, some gentle maltflavors, quite hoppy but not bitterness-driven, very little fruit in taste

Tap at mikkeller bar, copenhagen. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma has supreme combination of fresh hops, pine, leafs, fruitiness. High hopped, balaned malty body, long dry hoppy end. Very good apa.
Aroma is citrus and some pine. Hazy yellow with White head. Taste is light sweetness and heavy bitterness. Light body medium carbonation, very long bitter dry finish.

On tap at the Pony Bar in NYC. Pours a hazy golden with a white head and aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is hoppy, with nice citrus, lemon, and grapefruit along with pine and peach notes into the finish.

On tap at Robertas in Williamsburg. Perfect cap to the night. Cloudy light orange. Mild hops up front, but just enough to satisfy. Then its a little sweeter. Lightly toasted malts, a touch of earthy rye, and a finish that lasts forever, balanced between a dry, citrusy bitterness and a caramelly sweetness. This was a refreshing change from my usual pales, which tend to resemble session IPAs - really appreciated the balance. Very tasty.

Cette bière est incroyable. La plus régulière de toute les bières brassées chez Hill Farmstead, elle présente une robe orangée, trouble, avec une très bonne effervescence et un collet de carbonatation présent tout au long de la dégustation. Au nez, des arômes fins dagrumes et dhoublons exotiques sont facilement perceptibles, laissant percevoir un dry hop assez élaboré. Les arômes se transfèrent en bouche où lon retrouve ces agrumes, avec une légère amertume. Cette Edward est peut-être, pour moi, lépitôme de ce quest un haut degré de buvabilité dune bière. Un chef doeuvre.
Citrus pine aroma in a hazy gold pour. Laid back balance with hops to the fore and fruity malt perfectly complimenting them. A brew that defines the term moreish.

Fad/ Mikkeller: lys og delvis uklar, strå- henimod orangefarvet. Lidt hvid skum på toppen (måske et ordentligt "pour" kunne have givet et bedre resultat). Fantastisk frisk citrus, humlet, komplex, grassy aroma. Tør krop med ffin høj alkohol der balancerer humlen. Ikke stor mundfylde fra malt men meget Westcoast, og en øl der har fine delikate nuancer, uden at blive en hoppy eller fed. Top APA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy bright orange with a medium white head. Aroma is straight up dank, herbal hoppiness, citrussy, pineapple, fresh hops, grassy. Taste is full of mandarin,dank hops, fresh citrus fruits, light tropicalness, orange peel, grassy.
From tap at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, excotic fruit, caramel, spice and bitterness.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade.
Pours hazy darkish yellow with a nice, staying, creamy White head. Aroma has fresh hops, citrus, grapefruit, peach, Papaya, some crisp malts. Medium carbonation, fine dry and surprisingly creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is spot on, solid malty base, giving body to the brew, lots of hops, grassy, grapefruit, light citrus. Sharp herbal bite as well. Solid lingering bitterness. After two Double IPAs (from HF) this still stood out. Wow!

this is maybe the best PA i have ever tastet. pour cloudy orange with a fine white head. piny and lemon aromas, with exotic fruit notes. taste light bitter, really well balanced, average carbonation. light bodied but really tasty!
Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Golden hazy with medium white head. Sweet, fruits, citrus, pine a bit moldy, hops, resin. Bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body, low carbonation, a bit watery.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of tons of citrus and resin hops. Hazy golden amber with white lasting great. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet to dry. So smooth. Oily smooth texture, light+ carb., bitter resin hop finish.

Tap @mikkellerbar Aarhus. Light hazy golden orange pour. The nose is light tropical and lightly dank. The taste is light too - hoppy and pretty damn fresh and rich for an apa. Soft prisklasser mouthfeel and fairly fruity. Bitterness only in the aftertaste. Light mouthfeel medium carbonation. Great apa

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours a hazy multi-fruit-juicy orange with a big, white head. Aroma has super grassy, piny, grape fruit peely, citrussy, spicy, herbal hops. Not super fruity, but really nice and delicate. Taste is almost minty hoppy, fresh, light sweetness, overall pretty dry and crisp, light bitter finish. High carbonation and a crisp texture. Really tasty!

duft: frisk super meget duft frisk humle
smag: frisk humle citrus lidt bitter en smule appelsin frisk eftersmag frøn bitter humle
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Barcelona. Hazy amber colour with white head. Tropical fruits aroma. Tropical fruits, malty, sweet, resinous taste, bitter aftertaste. Medium body.

Tap. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, floral notes, earthy and piney. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and decent bitter. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice APA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Keg. Unclear orange, medium sized white head. Pine, citrus and onion/garlic in the nose. Flavour is hop forward and follows the nose. Pine, garlic, citrus, light candied fruit, bready malt. Medium body, oily texture, fine carbonation, mild sweet, medium bitter. Dry and bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Unclear orange with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit and a little tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, pine, grapefruit, little tropical fruit, little sweet and medium bitter.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, citrus and hops. Nice bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. unclear dark golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus and grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 070416
Tap. Pretty. Nice, rather wheat full nose. A little gym sock. Touch of orange. Taste follows. Well balanced. Could see this becoming popular.

On tap at Lionheart Pub. In the tulip, hazy dark honey gold. Head is there, not too substantive, but clings and sticks around. Might have been a touch cold, but the nose was a little vacant. Palate is wheat malty with a even steady hop through it. Very crafty balance. Nicely done.

Draft. Aroma of faint tangerine and pine. Cloudy copper with tight lace. Flavors are of wispy tangerine backed by a bit of caramel. The finish is preposterously dry with a hint of... gingerbread? Pretty damn wow.
Tap at Farmhouse & Grill, Burlington. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hops and malts. Very good drinkability.

If you like this kind of beer its hard to imagine something substantially better existing. Its a clean grassy piney citrus classic American pale. Its not the fruit bomb that something with Mosaic or Galaxy or Nelson would be because its old school in ingredients and style. And its pretty damn great.

Pours cloudy orange with a one finger white head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of fresh citrus, juicy tropical fruits, pine, grassy hops, melon, light bready malts, herbs, and dank hops. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a super creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long finish. Overall, a super tasty and drinkable, worldclass APA.

2 oz sampler. Hill Farmstead manages to pack a lot of taste and complexity into a reasonably small and subtle pale ale here. Hop aroma is moderate and pleasant, and the taste is a phenomenal combination of grain, hop aroma, and hop bitterness with nothing dominating or overwhelming the other. World-class pale ale.

Sample at Farmhouse Burlington. Murky amber with a thin of white head. Big juicy tropical fruit, bready malt, a touch of cat pee, peaches and apricots. Medium body, fine, limited carbonation. Tropical fruit, pine, peach, a bit raw and leafy; dry with fairly full bitterness and a kinda harsh finish.
Tap at Jeffrey. Golden pour sudsy white head with legs. Nose is lovely tropical fruits and yeast. Tastes of peach pit, pineapple, yeast, some cheese, and hay. Lovely palate. Damn good

Tap. Blackback Pub, Waterbury, VT. Very hazy gold. Thin, dense, clingy, white head. Very pithy citrus. Orange peel. Damp malts. Light herb. Taste is pithy, zesty bitter. Light dry. Light bodied. Very crisp. Finishes zesty bitter. Dry close.

On tap at brewery. Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Aroma is grapefruit, tropical fruits and pine. Flavor is citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruits, and pine. Amazing beer that lives up to the hype.

2L growler.

Deep hazy copper. Big white head. Excellent lacing. Excelleng retention.

Simple but clean hop aroma. Variety of citrus and pine. Nothing necessarily distinct or strong, but a nice hop nose. Biscuit malt rounds it out.

Perfect balance of hop and malt flavor. Never overpowering. Citrus, slight sweetness to the malt, then pine hops. Biscuit malt in the back and just a slight bitterness.
 Medium bodied. Drinkable in its balance. Medium carbonation. 

 It took me two glasses to really appreciate the majesty of this beer. Its everything I want in a pale ale and just about perfect.

So wonderful how all Hills beer has this quality of lightness both in the nose and in the drink. I think if I had to summarize Hills trademark as a brewer I would do it like this - He is trying to put the hops in the beer and leave them on the vine at the same time. He has a way with hops and in this beer they are so fruity and yet so light on the palate. Thats his other trademark, the light malt that is so light its like the beer wants to just float out of the glass. Crisp, light sweetness like a floral nectar, a bit of light sweet cracker that has exactly the perfect balance. The beer has a resonance rather than an aftertaste and its a light floral fruitiness. As the beer warms some sweet grass and pine comes forward and this is just a lovely beer.

Pours a slightly clouded orange, pale white head. Nose is bready, grassy, pine, orange juice. Taste is slightly sweet - balances hop dosage well, juicy, citrus city, bready, light light malt, great balance.. Goes down so easy. One of the best APAs out there.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2014 Had a few times over the week. Probably just easiest to read other peoples reviews. Fairly juicy and bitter but also extremely balanced. Grapefruit, citrus, cracker, a bit grainy, but it works here.  id replace my cold water tap with it if I could

Growler. Hazy. Lace. Aroma is really fresh vegetal hops. Very ripe tropical fruit. Flavor is juicy sweet hop sack acids grapefruit plenty of light crackr malt. Incredible balance. Feel is dusty lively vegetal. Really great.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Golden peach colour. Aroma is fruity and very aromatic - lovely smell. Taste is oh so fruity for a pale ale; lovely. Nice hop resin on finish for an American Pale. Overall great American pale ale.

Cask at NERAX 2013, draught at Three Penny Taproom and Pro Pig, 3/15 and 3/16/14The cask sample of this was just stunning. Wonderfully hoppy and beautifully bright and clear. Light malt sweetness and a touch of light caramel add just enough balance and character to prevent this from being just a mouthful of hops. Not that its too acidic by any means. Tons of simcoe juiciness, with all kinds of citrus complexity from all the C-hops. Soft and supple on the palate with no alcohol or flaws.The draught versions seemed a little less "juicy" and soft, with more hop bitterness apparent. Probably the increased carbonation levels (and both draught samples were rather hazy, adding some dullness from the sediment). Still, like Susan, this manages a ton of hop flavor with very little fatigue from the acids. Deliciously dry and clean, of course.
Cloudy light golden with two fingers of soapy white head. On the nose there is citrus, pine, earthiness. The taste follows well in suit. One of the best APAs out there. Glad I finally got to try it.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Ce qui définit cette divine bière est son équilibre, autant dans le dosage de ses composantes que dans son goût. Trouble, dorée et mousseuse à souhait, la Edward a toutes les qualités de ce que doit être une bonne bière de soif : une bonne amertume gracieuseté du houblonnage généreux qui procure des saveurs herbacées, fruitées et épicées, et un goût de céréales bien présent pour soutenir le tout. Très très bonne bière!
Perfect , this is what a pale ale should taste like. Balanced and delicious. I dont need to be nerdy about it. If you can get it, drink it enjoy it and shut Your mouth

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2014 Nice floral and citrus hop aroma and flavor. Balanced and full. Very enjoyable ipa. Bitter finish but enough citrus hop to balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is hazed pale golden amber with a perfectly tight white head. Nose is huge hop, well balanced pale malt and grain bill with notes of weed and a strong citrus punch. Taste is a touch more balanced, very drinkable. Grain bill is more pronounced with a light pale malt. Hops are herbal ad citrusy, grassy notes linger with a very light bitterness, assertive carbonation and a light airy body.
Growler - nose is stronger citrus, orange and peach. Taste also has more hops, some citrus and some fresh fruity green notes, still well balanced grain, clean and fresh. Bitterness is a touch less than I remember.

Draft. Pours murky orange with thin white head that dissipates. Smells of hops with little carbonation. Nice complex ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I think I have an idea of how HFB is so successful. Its the look of their beers. No brewer makes beer that is this appetizing to look at. Its like McDonalds for Christ sake, they have perfected the smell, the food is shit of course, but no human can resist the smell from the bag when pull away from the drive-thru. Now, HFB backs up the look of the beer with extraordinary quality and taste, and this is no exception but looking at the pint as its pulled from the tap at the brewery, my mouth is watering. Golden cloudy deliciousness.

750 mL growler. Thanks Moy! The pour is a reddish orange gold with a thinner white head that leaves a beautiful lace on the brewery tulip. The aroma is incredible. Citrusy hops, with a grapefruit character and a tropical fruitiness to it. Maybe a light piny sensation on the back end. The flavor is so similar. The hoppiness is heavy, but there isn't a overbearing bitterness. The fruitiness and light sweetness at the end is delightful. The mouth feel is almost perfect, and the dryness at the end is outstanding for an APA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Reservoir: Pours cloudy straw with a nice white head. Lots of citrus, grapefruit, on the nose. Flavor is grapefruit, slight pine, slight biscuit, and a nice hoppy finish. Medium bodied, perfect carbonation, I could live off this beer.

Growler thanks to Mads. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Lovely citrus hoppy aroma, with grapefruit and orange, along with peach and pine. Dry, citrus hoppy flavour with no disturbing signs of malt or yeast. Fabulous!
On draught at Three Penny. Another excellent brew from HF. Cant go wrong with anything they make just wish I didnt have to drive 4 hours to get it.

Light orange with a haze and creamy white head. Huge fresh hop and citrus in the nose. Mellow sweetness, lemon citrus, slight pine, subtle bitterness, biscuit. Delicate mouthfeel. Wonderful complex IPA.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Grainy, Mild Malty, Mild Bittering Hops

T: Malty, Bittering Hops, Mild Grainy

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Overall, a nice balanced pale ale...nothing more, nothing less

On draft in a tulip glass at Farmhouse tap and grill. An amazing little beer. Fresh aromas of pine and citrus, but not overdone or aggressive like so many pale ales (that are more like "light" versions of a bigger IPA). Excellent balance, this beer is all about a deft touch and reminding you that a pale ale should be about finesse rather than density. Just enough hops for your mouth to play around with but nothing more. Easy drinking and left me wanting more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared growler.
Appearance: Slightly hazy amber body with a short light tan head.
Aroma: Orange and pineapple, very citrus heavy. Moderate strength.
Taste: Thin with lots of citrus, bitter orange mostly. Clean and short finish.
Palate: Light bodied, highly carbonated.
Overall: Clean pale ale, but not out of this world. The growler was 2 weeks old though, would try again fresh.

2L growler puchased 10/23. Pours hazy dark orange with 1 finger head. Nose is subtle citrus, lemon, mango. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, round, smooth. Taste is bitter orange, lemon, earthy mango, peach, balanced. Finish is bitter citrus, pineapple, fruit. Very good!
Amazing brew. Very flowery and citrus and pine perfectly balanced. MAjor ligue APA.

FROM NOTES: July 3, 12
Consumed from a Tulip poured fresh on tap at Hill Farmstead Brewery in June 2012. 

A: Pine notes, pineapple notes, grapefruit notes, powerful tropical notes in this WORLD CLASS nose! 
A: Pours a hazy orange with finger-width head and lots of lacing.
T: Follows the other-worldly nose, plenty of hop flavor, but not a ton of bitterness on the back-end, malt profile manages to live up the hops, but not a whole of lot of the biscuity malt profile thats more common to the style. 
P: Smooth with plenty of carbonation, this beer is EXTREMELY quaffable, extremely. 
O: The best APA Ive ever had. This beer lives up to the hype and makes me want to move to Vermont. Serving type: on-tap at the source
Easily the best ipa i have had. During a week in which i had zombie dust, Dreadnought, Ghandi -bot, double dose, and heady topper. This beer stood above in aroma and taste and finish. very enjoyable

Draft at blackback pub. Amazing beer good hop flavor. Finish is perfect and the aroma is nice. Not too hoppy or too much citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bomber shared by jsprime. hazed orange with a white head. simple c hop and cara malt nose. a very classic apa exteremly well executed. not quite as clean as the other HF pale we tried but still quite good.

10/13/13. Growler thanks to ZMDR1975. Orange pour with a nice khaki head that sticks and laces decently. Nice hop aroma, good dose of pine, citrus, and resin. Great flavor, not too bitter, full of fresh hoppy flavor, plenty of pine, citrus, etc. without being overly bitter or malty. Tasty.

750ml Growler, best consumed by October 9, 2013. Another wonderful gift from Mark!

Pours hazy orange with a nice three finger head that leaves great lacing and holds a good cap.

Aroma is pineapple, tropical fruits, citrus, some notes of pine, floral, very mild bready malt, but this is all about the hops. Good strength.

Flavor is more big hops, juicy, tropical fruits, pineapple, grapefruit, citrus, touch of pine, mild bready malt, very little sweetness, very dry overall, solid bitterness. Exceptionally hoppy for a Pale Ale!

Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, a little sticky, good carbonation.

Fantastic Pale Ale! Very unbalanced, which is what I like. Let the hops steal the show and thats what weve got here. A real treat...never thought Id get a chance to try anything from Hill Farmstead!

A- from 750ml growler. Pours a hazy, light orangey gold with a solid egg shell white head. Good lacing. S- aromas of lemon, grapefruit, orange, fresh cut grass, pine, soap, herbs, biscuits and some earthy mustiness. M- light creamy bodied and mild acidic palate. T- begins with a tart citrus, grapefruit and lemon. Bitter grasses, pine, and some floral notes. Ending is clean and dry. Crackers, herbs and lingering citrus. Relatively simple and expected but well handled all the same.

Pours from a swingtop bottle a hazy yellow color with a medium thick fluffy white head that recedes gradually to a wispy film. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, hops and bready malt. Light-bodied with flavors of piney hops, grapefruit and malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a citrusy hops aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.
On tap at the Farmhouse in Burlington, hazy golden color, subtle flavors of pine and orange, other citrus flavors and vanilla... creamy as can be... understated but absolutely delicious!

Bottle shared by Tony. Pours hazy dark straw color with white head. Aromas of pine and citrus with some grass. Similar flavors with moderate bitterness and citrus rind. Medium body with average carbonation. Great beer!
An absolutely other-worldly beer from one of the best breweries on the planet. Unbelievable.

Draft at brewery. Hazy gold/ amber with white head. Very hop forward, grass and pine forest in nose with fruit and pine in the finish. Another great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aesthetically amazing. Pours a hazy amber with a beautifully thick vanilla-colored head that sticks around. Hoppy and floral aroma treats the nose. Foamy head still around when going to drink, major lacing. Flavor is surprisingly weak. Hoppy. Very dry aftertaste. Great, great beer
On tap at Three Penny, great citrus and pine aroma, taste is very well balanced with a light bitter and dry finish, great pale ale.

Sampled while waiting in line at the brewery, then twice more since then from fresh growlers. Such an elegant expression of hop character, very delicate and yet very flavourful. While Walden delivers a similar overall drinking experience, Edward proves to be more citrus-forward where Walden was more green and herbal. Both do a remarkable job of showcasing all that fresh hops have to offer, married to dry crackery light malts. Artistry.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Good brew, I expected a little more hop in the aroma dept. Still a great example of the AIPA style.
Rich citrus aroma with caramel notes. Taste is perfectly balanced with floral notes and grapefruit. Mildly tart finish.

Huge thanks to my friend Mike for sharing this with me! Growlered recently (unsure of specific date); pours 8/18/13. Hazy straw-gold color with a thick, fluffy white head; great head retention. Aroma is incredibly clean and pure; pine, citrus, grass, some sweetness (vanilla?). Taste is similar and fantastic; grass, floral, citrus, pine, slightly sweet. Excellent. Beautiful, rich lacing. Medium carbonation. Medium bodied. Highly drinkable; no alcohol burn evident. This will be the APA to which I compare others from this point on.

750 ml growler direct from brewery. Pours a nice hazy yellow with a large pillowy white head. Aromas are citrus, pine, tropical fruit, and some sort of malt background (bread or earth). Taste has a good malt presence up front (again bready and earthy) and perhaps a touch of caramel but pine resin and grapefruit asserts itself immediately. Oily texture, medium body, and soft carbonation with a medium astringent finish. Very nice APA but enough of a hop bomb to be considered an IPA in my opinion.

Growler: &nbsp Fiery amber, very pale haze, large frothy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Soft floral and candied citrus peel on the nose. &nbsp Smooth somewhat oily start, hoppy, citrusy, nice little bite to it. &nbsp Very fresh, 

but not as aromatic as I would have thought. &nbsp Floral aspect fades somewhat quickly. &nbsp Moderate to full bodied. &nbsp A little pithy on the finish. &nbsp Solid, well made, but I still prefer Zombie Dust (but not by much). &nbsp 

Big thanks to chouffe for giving me the opportunity to try this!

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 On tap @ Prohibition Pig. Pours a cloudy golden amber color with a small fluffy white head. Big aroma of citrus, grapefruit, melon, and grain. Taste is bready, sweet citrus, orange rind, and lots of grapefruit bitterness.
Orange pale gold, just a touch cloudy. Smells of oranges. I taste malty sweet, then sharp citrus acidity, then piney hop. Very nice.

Growler, 07/29/2013. Pours hazy orange, large frothy head dies to a nice pillow on the surface, lacing clinging to the glass all the way down. Aroma is dank, tangerine and grapefruit flesh, herbal dry hopped notes, peach and mango, earthy caramel malts mild in the finish. Taste is orange, peach, tropical notes transition to grapefruit and mild caramel, biscuit, giving way to bright pine notes, tingling, dry finish. Medium body, creamy and balanced, extremely drinkable. Excellent without a doubt.

Pour is hazy golden with nice white head and lots of lacing. Aroma is very hoppy with lots of citrus (grapefruits but also some orange), piney and spicy notes, tropical fruits (mangos, peaches), light malt presence. Taste is mainly citrusy and tropical hops with some piney notes and just enough malt to hold everything. Low to medium body and medium carb. One of the best APA out there if not THE best. Beautiful.

Growler sample shared with the group. Pours a hazy orange amber color with a medium sized white head. The aroma has fruity citrus and floral hops,mild bready malts, some sweetness, hhints of grass. The flavor has a bready malt base, citrus and some tropical fruit, grass, hints of caramel and a touch of resin. Pretty tasty example of the style.
Grolwer pour @ pw, thanks fitz. This one is great, a juicy and flaoral APA that is immensely crushable.

Sample at the brewery on 7/6/13. Clear amber pour with a thick off-white head. Malty and grassy nose with pine and grapefruit notes. Malty and piney flavor with some slight peach before a mild finish.

Tap: Poured a hazy bright yellow color ale with large pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of floral hay and citrus notes with fruity ester and quite incredible. Taste is also dominated by fresh citrus notes with nice floral notes with fresh crisp cereal notes. Body is about average with great carbonation. Loads of hoppy with very limited amount of bitterness. Another winner from this brewer.

Draft at the Blackback Pub in Waterbury, VT. Killer! How did they get that much flavor in a 5% beer?! Great fresh aroma of citrus hops, this beer is so fresh and full of citrus hop goodness. Worthy of the hype!

On tap somewhere in Vermont
Aroma mild , soft yet so wonderfully done. Rich fresh hops , floral with sweet malts. Mints of mango and peach with resinous finish. Superb nose.9+
 Appearance  
Top: white large cap , creamy that left rings on glass.
Base: hazy gold with hint of pale amber.
Palate :  soft, easy going with mild carbonation. Medium bodied with medium walls. Long lasting finish.
Taste: citrus with floral sides. Clean with balancing mild sweet malts. Resinous finish.
 Other notes Superb, easy going ale. Excellent exposure of flavours. Intelligent set up. True master craft. Gentle and bold in one. Deserve its hype.

Had as a taster at the brewery - have a growler and will update once Ive had a full glass. Pours a hazy golden color. Medium head, strong lacing. Moderate hop aroma on nose. Smooth on palate, well-balanced. Something sharp mid taste (cant identify), long finish. Little spruce maybe? Excellent complex pale ale.

Drank on tap (12 oz) at The Farmhouse Tap & Grill in Burlington (VT) on June 21, 2013. Honey and hazy pale orange, small head. Hoppy aroma of grapefruit and peaches. The taste is quite the same, but a little more juicy and dry, good bitterness. Good way to honor their grand dad!
6/29/13 Framhouse. Damn close to a perfect beer. Citrus blast nice hop balance and flavor. I love this the most of all HF.

Draft at HF. Pours a hazed gold with a nice creamy white head. Nose is a good blend of citrus and resin, super clean and fresh. Low malt with subtle sweetness. Floral as well. On tasting, medium bitterness with a big hop presence. Smooth and low sweetness that balances well. Citrus and floral. Fantastic apa.
Had this on tap at both Hill Farmstead and Three Penny Taproom Vt.  Poured cloudy beige with off white head, citrus pine and strong hop sent.  Very drinkable, tasted better on each sip.
On tap at Blue Dog in Chalfont, PA. Probably my least favorite HF beer to this point, especially after drinking the amazing Everett. Solid pale ale, but doesn't stand out.
Pours a murky amber with white head and good lace. Very strong citrus aroma, bitter, grapefruit and other citrus hoppiness, pine. More of a IPA than a pale ale.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2013 Growler thanks to czar, HUGE thanks man! Pours a cloudy golden with a sufficient head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is full of dank hops with grapefruit and pine undertones. Taste is highly bitter with not much balancing sugar but thats OK. Flavors are once again hops-derived with a bit of tropical fruits, mangoes and grapefruits to be exact. The bitter aftertaste carries on for an extended duration. A really good... APA... err... IPA? Whatever, great stuff!

Tap. Pours cloudy amber with a medium off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma is fairly light, with notes of citrusy grapefruit, mango, perhaps passionfruit. Flavor is the same, lightly sweet, light-plus bitter. Dry finish. Medium body, soft and creamy "HF" mouthfeel.

750ml growler muled by jercraigs & mabel - hurrah!!  Hazy orange, huge fluffy lasting off-white head - a couple of floaties.  Dry leafy/resin bitter aroma, some alcohol, citrus zest.  Taste follows - dry, biscuit - did I say dry? - solid.  Chewy, astringent, solid carbonation, longish finish - like dried wildflowers.  Loved it.

Hazy orange tinged with gold, white lacing. Sweet pineapple, grapefruit, mango, peach, and citrus aroma. Very faint sweet and bitter taste. Crisp, light-bodied, but somewhat thin. A little bitterness in the finish and no alcohol presence.
This is an amazon beer. Great nose of citrus, pineapple and juicy peaches. The taste is amazing bitter but not so close that you would put into an ipa category. One of my favorites!

Tropical orange, white head, lots of lacing and champagne like carbonation.  Really seems like an IPA because its got so much hop going on, but its very drinkable and, on second sip, more balanced than you first think with all the hops there.  Amazing that you could get this much flavor in something thats 5.2%

Dégustée en fût au Farmhouse Tap & Grill à Burlington,  VT. De couleur dorée foncée et voilée.  Nez de houblon fruité (agrumes,  moyen de fruits tropicaux), légèrement citrique aux notes herbeuses et résineuses, moyen de céréales fraîches avec des notes de pain et de levures épicées (poivre doux). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse. Goût moyennement amer de houblon fruité et citrique (agrumes, léger de fruits tropicaux, notes dabricots) aux notes herbeuses (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) accompagné de notes de levures épicées (poivre très doux) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de céréales fraîches et très légèrement sucrées ainsi que des notes de pain puis en finale lamertume de houblon se fait plus herbeuse (herbes fraîches) avec de faibles traces résineuses.  Post-goût moyen et aux notes sèches, moyennement amer de houblon fruité, herbeux et légèrement citrique avec des notes de céréales. (3 avril 2013)

Growler from the brewery. Pours a full, shiny matte gold with frothy white head. Phenomenal aroma with everything youd want in a pale ale: Grapefruit, perfume, lemon rind, with just a slight background of pine and yeast. Slight biscuit in flavor but mainly juicy lemon rind, perfume, and grapefruit. Slight, soft lingering pine and lemon rind finish. The qualities here are like having a grass fed locally raised beef burger after years of fatty Piggly Wiggly ground beef. Damn drinkable and subtly addicting.

On tap at Mad Taco in Waitsfield, VT. Pours a hazy, deep gold with a foamy white head that hangs around. Aroma is a warm hops over citrus. Flavor is high citrus backed up by several hops in succession but remains bright and effervescent. Slightly bitter and refreshing aftertaste. Overall this is a beer with character but is not overpowering. Very drinkable.

Growler. Thanks to AdamJackson. Ohh Shit. Hayy yellow with a white head and lacings. Fruit forest. Tropical paradise. Red grapefruit, lemon, pine and strawberries. Bitter, crisp, dry and smooth. Long bitter finish. Incredible.

Appearance:  Pours a hazy amber gold with a subsided white head.

Aroma:  Tangerine, sativa dominate medical cannabis and toffee like malt.




Taste: Toffee, citris and piny hops, melon fruitiness. Finishes with earthy lingering bitterness.


Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, probably a bigger mouthfeel than most APAs, attributed to the lack of filtration.


Overall:  Very tasty, vibrant, fresh and more complex than my go to, every day drinking American Pale Ales.

Une dernière pour la route en portion dégustation. Superbe bière qui impression par ses effluves de fruits tropicaux. La robe est dorée avec une couche de mousse blanche. La bouche est bien constituée, légère, facile à souhait, larchétype de la bière idéale. Jadore.

Tap at Torst.. Pale gold with a nice one finger head. Smell is citrus, pine, peaches. Taste is same but more tropical fruit.. very nice touch of bitterness and clean crisp finish. Real nice. A little thin.

Growler thanks to Peter. Pour is cloudy copper with minimal head. Aroma and flavor with clean citrus hop notes and light caramel malt. Faint hay and earth in the background. Also light dank. Very good.

En fût sur place.  Un corps doré qui sembrouille et qui montre une belle tête résistante.  Un nez frais et stimulant daiguilles de pin, dherbes fraîches et de fruits tropicaux.  Des céréales qui ne murmurent que lessentiel.  Des papilles qui tombent dans le ravissement le plus total : une horde houblonnée désaltérante et des céréales qui ne sont jamais sucrées. Une bouche presque parfaite.  Un pétillement vif dans un corps longiligne.  Une finale remplie de soleil et damertume.  Quoi dire de plus?
Deep peach color with citrus scent. Incredible layered lacing. Flavor was pine and citrus, grapefruit pith and resin.  Incredibly well balanced apa.

Draught at Gingerman NYC.  Pours peachy yellow with a foamy white head.  Aroma of citrus fruits: both orange and huge amoutns of grapefruit.  Taste is of a citrus pith but very smooth. Notes of pine and grass. Slightly bitter but excellent finish. Terrific beer.
Cloudy Gold Pour with a white head.  A very good hop mix for a pale ale.  Some nice fruits, citrus, resin, and a little pine flavor.  It is damn good!

On tap at Claire's in Hardwick, VT.

Hazy amber brown with small off-white head and good lacing.

Aroma of bread, orange, citrus, pine and caramel.

Taste of bread, floral hops, orange, citrus, pine and caramel.

Medium body and high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh hops assault my nostrils. Mildly sweet & fruity notes from the hops. Crisp, refreshing taste. This particular pour tastes a bit old, but I know from experience that Edward is quite a bit better fresh. This one is quite underrated; totally sessionable and delicious.
(On tap au Farmhouse tap n grill): Pamplemousse tout le long, bonne amertume franche. Buvabilité dun autre monde.

6oz pour at Farmhouse Tap and Grill in Burlington.  Hazy orange with thin lacing white head.  Nose is both musty and juicy, fresh orange peel, orange juice, grapefruit juice, pine tar, pine needles, soap.  Flavor is almost exactly the same, grapefruit zest, orange juice, dried pine tar, meyer lemon, lime zest.  Dry, lightly bitter, refreshing finish.  Superb.

This poured a light orange color with an off white head.  Aroma was citrus, light grain, some grass, and some earthy notes.  Flavor was much the same, very well balanced between juicy hops and light grain. Great example of the style.
Thanks to Matt for this one.  Damn.  Wow.  Pours a hazy gold, white head.  Juicy, piney, resinous, citrus, herbal hops, stone fruit, yeast.  I could drink this beer all day...EVERY DAY.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 Sampled at the brewery.  Pours cloudy golden.  A lot of hops and some malts.  Flavor of a lot of citrus and bitter hops.  Average texture.  A great pale ale.  Edit: Many, many growler pours after the original sample.  This is the best pale ale in existence.

Dark gold and hazy.  Huge thick off white head.  Stunning appearance.  Oranges, fresh cut grass, and slight earthy/piney aroma.  Flavor starts out with oranges, light bready malt, lemon, grapefruit, resin.  Ends crisp, dry and bitter.  Medium carbonation and medium to light body.  Awesome lacing down the glass.  This APA is a true masterpiece.

Poured from a 20L keg in my garage into HF glassware. A nice opaque glowing orange color with a one finger head. Scent is floral orangy citrus with a slight hay/farmyard hint, really fantastic. Taste is tons of citrus with a nice hop bitterness on the finish. This is the beer that changed my life when it comes to craft beers... really a fantastic APA

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 [4676-20120817] Tap. Mild sweaty yeast aroma. Slightly hazy, light brown orange body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter buttery yeast flavour. Medium body. Delicious. (7/3/7/4/16) 3.7
(@ Campground Brewdown 2012, Millmont, PA)

[4920B-20120102] 750mL bottle. Yeasty straw grains aroma has a light orange note. Slightly hazy, light orange body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Bitter dry citrus peel flavour has a lemony pip aftertaste. Good. (6/4/7/3/14) 3.4
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)

[5252B-20130426] Tap. Fragrant floral orange grapefruit rind hops aroma. Hazy, orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Bitter orange rind hops and creamy citrus seed malt flavour. Medium-full body. Delicious, a great introduction to our Vermont excursion! (8/5/9/4/17) 4.3
(@ Parker Pie, West Glover, VT)

Thanks to Turd for sharing! Another superb, richly flavorful, and impressively balanced pale from HF. Nice deep orange pour, medium cloudy, with a generous head. Nose is massively floral, with a slight sharpness to it. Full, vibrant mouthfeel with a touch of a dry finish. Some more hop leaf and resin in the taste, green and fresh, but not at the expense of the modest fruitiness. Excellent stuff overall.

On tap at the farm house tap room in Burlington. Great beer. Milder version of the abner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Orange glow almost florescent in the glass. Nice light frothy head. Poured into HF steamware from my keezer. The aromas are heavy florals. The taste profile is waves of light hoppy bitterness. Florals and citrus are upfront, with a clean light finish.

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp. Nov. 2. Pours a murky orange/peach-colour with an average size diminishing frothy white head. Aroma of citrusy and fruity hops, a touch catty and also a bit spicy. Fruity and citrusy flavour, also catty and herbal. Average to medium bodied. Another great IPA from these guys!

Growler. Pours a golden orange with big white head. Aroma is pine, fresh cut grass and some mild hops. Taste is slight resin fresh hop, then a very earthy/soil taste that is very fresh but very dirt like. More fresh cut grass taste that is very nice from a refreshment stand point. The mouth feel is really light here and makes it seem almost watered down. The carbonation is slightly low but could be the growler. Overall, a very nice session beer with a great deal of flavor.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2012 On tap at my home-brew clubs Christmas party tonight.
Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a nice bone white head that persists forever. Wow that aroma has got lots of hops in it for a Pale ale! Juicy citrus and pine with a hint of green onion and a touch of bready malt make for a wonderful smelling beer. The flavor is loaded with pine and citrus with a bit of sweet malt to back it up. Flavorful bitterness, but never harsh. Medium to light body with a moderate to high level of carbonation and a bready resinous mouthfeel. This is a great little beer, that at times feel more like and IPA, but its so damn good Im not going to quibble of stylistic designations.

On tap at home from a keg that is 3 days old (picked up at the brewery).  Pours a hazy orange. Citrus and floral aroma.  You can taste the hops right away, with some pine undertones.  Just a gorgeous APA.

An excellent pale ale.  On tap at Blind Tiger.  Pours a pale orange yellow color with white foam head.  Aroma of grapefruit and earthiness.   Sweet smooth citrus flavor with a malt layer to smooth it out.  A light feel but perfect for the style.  Perhaps some spice mixed in. Definitely session worthy.
750 flip top growler thanks to time4lunch. Citrus and some grapefruit. Tropical fruit. Light and aromatic. Incredibly tasty. Just another homerun from HF.
On draft at farmhouse tap..from notes..clean..fragrant and oh so aromatic..very fresh..hop presence is not overwhelming..very stellar apa..this could be the finest session apa around...

.Growler, Thanks Dany!!!! Shared with Riley. Pours hazy orange, 1-finger white head, phenomenal lacing. Nose is tropical fruit, grapefruit, grass, stinky hop-juice, really snappy. Flavours of grapefruit, tropical fruit, quite bitter, nice pine and cedar deeper in. Gorgeous, just lovely beer in every way possible.

Nice fresh hoppy citrus aroma as soon as it gets close to your nose...  I even got an edelweiss flour hit which got me all excited.   Well balanced and sustained bitterness would have thought this to be an IPA

(Draught) cloudy, ruddy deep orange, thick meringue-like head. Nose is funky, hop extract, fresh as hell citrus zest and pulp and cream. Taste of biscuit, mildly bitter, funk, cream, melon, complex and delicious. Near perfect carbonation and palate finish. One of the best pale ales Ive ever tried.

Brewfest. Yellow pour with a small white head. Clean malt profile, subdued yet very interesting hop profile, nothing else to get in the way. What more can I say? Very clean, dry, and just great to ship on.

Bomber shared by TURDFERGUSON. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a white head. Nose is -- wow -- insanely hoppy. Freshest possible hop aroma. Tastes citrusy and just a bit more resiny than I would like. Something herbal metallic that doesnt quite match the beauty of the aroma. Still, this is amazing, especially given the sessionability.

Draught
Pours a hazy yellow with a big head and good lacing on the glass.

The aroma is hop forward, not insanely pungent, but nice... lots of leafy and floral hops, some pine and a good citrus rind character. 

The flavor is very bitter, wonderfully so... it is also fairly dry... I keep thinking that this beer is akin to De La Sennes Band of Brothers, not in as much as that the beers taste alike, but the philosophy behind them seems to match up, ie. not holding back on bitterness, letting the hops do the talking, but at the same time never becoming anywhere close to astringent, unpleasant, or otherwise disagreeable, & maintaining dryness and low gravity. The hop flavor is layered, and in its own way multi faceted. There is a nice leafy character that is present just enough to be delicious without becoming annoying or overbearing the way that this flavor can sometimes do in hoppy beers. The bitter citrus rind and grapefruit are central and mild notes of pine certainly peek out from time to time. The malt is not particularly "on display" but it is very clean and a mild honey note does shine through. 
I guess Im in the "cool kids" club now.

On tap at HF.
Pours hazy golden with high white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of pine, resinous, malt. Taste is of pine, resinous, malt. Palate: a tad thin, but very refreshing ;). Overall: Very good.

Was served at Harvest, midday afternoon. Pours an orange-tinted amber with a frothy, legging head. Smells of grass, reguliarized Abner, coastal salt, and minerals. Tastes of hops, roses, pizza dough, tangerine sweetness, grapefruit zest, and lavender. This tastes quite simply like a less alcoholic, fruitier version of Abner.  Delicious!

750 ml growler shared by bsuedekum- thanks again, Blake! Pours a hazed gold color with a small white head. Aroma of herbal, grassy hops, citrus, apricot, pale malts, and a little bit of pine. Flavor of herbal, grassy, piney hops, mixed fruits, straw, and pale and sweet malts. Light-bodied, with a dry mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Actually a lot like Half Acre Daisy Cutter, and thats a very good thing.

Draft at Capones. Pours a nice hazy orange with a lasting white head. Aroma is slightly citrusy but very subdued. Taste is surprisingly malty for HF. Very creamy but still has a nice hop punch. The hops tend more toward a citrus characteristic than a pine one. Very easy to drink.

Oh man, I heard so much about Hill Farmstead and this does not disappoint.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a small white top and great lacing.  Aroma of big citrus hops, sweet, light caramel malts.  Taste is a great balance of citrus and earthly hops and light bread and caramel malts.  I wish I had more access to this.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 2012-11-02. Hazy orange body with a small off-white head. 3+ Modest hoppy aroma, light citrus, light leafy character. 7+ Flavour is similar, nice citrus, modest bitterness throughout. 7+ Average bodied palate. Solid, but less citrusy than I remember it on draft. 7/3/7/3/16+ Bottle shared by Blankboy
2012-08-17. Hazy orange body with a nice white head. 3+ Pleasant modest bitterness throughout, modest citrus, orange and tangerine seeds in the finish. 7++ Similar aroma, nice citrus character, orange and tangerine, light green leafy hop touches. 7+ Smooth average plus bodied palate suits it. Solid pale ale, it is not as richly citrusy as some of their others, but I dont think it is meant to be. Very quaffable, pleasantly hoppy. Nice stuff. 7/4/8/3/16 3.8 On tap, Campground Brewdown 2012 courtesy of  j12601 Overheard: "Im drinking Edward... its not sparkly... it dies in the sunlight like a REAL vampire."

Draft at Railroad. Pours a dark beige witj some head that leaves some lacing. Noose is simco hops with slight sweet cotton candy maltiness. First Sip is delicious with crystal malt sweet  followed by mild citrus bitterness with bergamont and cumquat. finish is mild grapefruit.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Enjoyed on tap at Prohibition Pig. Cloudy peach coloured body, with no head. OK drinkability, good hop flavour.  Carbonation right there. Had again on tap At blackback.

Growler at home shared with friends. Poured a golden orange in appearance with a small white head and decent lacing. Huge hop aroma with big pine, grass, resin, weed, and a hint of grapefruit. Taste is dank, with flavors of pine, and grass, with light touches of caramel and grapefruit. Light body with medium carbonation. Super potent, with huge hop flavors, yet very well-balanced and sessionable. Well-Done.

Draught at Farm House Tap and Grill. Huge hop noseorange, melon, passion fruit, lovely citrus and tropical fruit salad. Dirty, cloudy orange-gold with lace. Estery, creamy flavor, creamsicle, orange, biscuit and grain, a touch of caramel. Big bitter finish. Just a touch of butter or cream. Fabulous fruit and great flavor for a 5.2% beer. Drinks like an Imperial IPA. Really miraculous flavor for the abv.

Growler provided by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The beer appears mostly clear and orange in color. For some reason, my pour was more transparent than others. Interesting.

The aroma brings an array of pleasant hop and citrus notes.

The beer is very flavorful and enjoyable. Light on the palate, and effortless to drink, this is only one of two growlers that enticed me enough to go back for seconds that evening. Well balanced and delicious. By well balanced, the hops play the lead role, but the various citrus and hop flavors meld together harmoniously.

The feel is a bit on the thin side, but at 5.2% and packed with flavor, Im OK with that.

I definitely recommend this beer. It would be quite easy to throw back a few pints of Edward.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 03-12-2011

Pours a hazy orange color with an average size head. Aroma is of pine and tropical notes. Flavor is full of the hop aroma and a hidden malt body that prevents any overwhelming bitterness. This balance makes this a very easy to drink beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at farm house tap. Pours orange with massive head. Big citrus aroma and refreshing hop forward taste.

like that check please! .. . pours a light hazed yellow gold .. . slick hoppiness, pine and resin .. . very nice finish .. . a good good brew!!

 .. . . i prefer a quiet night at home, with my hand on the buzzer .....

This is an excellent beer. One of our favorites. I get to visit this brewery once a year and each time is terrific and Edward has always been enjoyed.

Malt: hay
Hops: floral, grass
Yeast/Bacteria: dough
golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Draft.  Massive hop aroma - fruity/grassy fresh hops jump out of the glass, grapefruit, pine sap, cut hay, and a very pleasant sweet malt note in the background.  Pours hazy, light orange color, white head with good retention and lacing.  Flavor is packed with fresh hops.   Sticky resin, grassy, grapefruit, light tropical fruit.  Malt profile is very nice, light biscuit and graham cracker, pleasant (light) background sweetness.  The hop and malt profiles work very well together - both add their own unique flavors without becoming messy.  Bitterness is medium-high, but the malt definitely helps support this.  Light-medium body, soft texture, medium carbonation.  Excellent beer - glad I was able to try it.

Draft. Pleasantly found this on tap at an Inn I was staying at in Vermont as it was a must try while in the area.. You dont have to try too many Hill Farmstead brews to start expecting the best when trying something from them. And, with that, this is probably the best, or certainly one of the best, Pale Ales Ive had. Its aggressively hopped; citrus, grassy notes, but perfectly balanced by a sweet malty body. Everything glides along quite well.  This has a lengthy dry finish with crisp bitterness that might be found in some IPAs. Yet, its all fairly light in a very drinkable package. Yum.

Draft, Three Penny Taproom. Ok, so another flawless Hill Farmstead brew. The brewmasters description is spot on. Hazy orange color. Taste and nose mirror each other. Yeast, malt and hops are perfect. Lots of dry hopping. I really respect everything Shaun Hill has done at his farm. I dont personally drink many Pale Ales or seek them out BUT this is damn nice. And Pale ale drinkers should find this on draft or make the drive to Greensboro. Exceptional brew with lots of character.
Tap at dive bar, worcester mass. Quite possibly my favorite beer. Huge flavor and aroma. Hop filled, juicy sticky delicious hops. Unbelievable. Only 5% too. Could be best beer ever

Pale copper, no head. Aroma of citrus, herbal notes and some pine taste follows bringing herbal notes forward. Solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample shared by alexsdad06. Poured cloudy copper color with an average frothy off-white head that lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex citrus hop aroma. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. Medium to full body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Very good brew that exceeded my expectations.

Tasted over two days from a 750ml bottle fresh from the brewery.

The aroma of grass and citrus is this beers strength--close to perfection. Im less impressed with the taste--nothing particularly bad about it but quite bland/watery compared to the aroma. Very little taste left for the finish.

Overall Edward is Probably the best American Pale Ale Ive tasted, but to me its much closer to an Imperial IPA and doesnt quite stack up against something like Heady Topper. If you like to smell but not taste your hops this would be your ideal beer.

On tap at Boilermaker.  Poured a cloudy light amber with orange hues and a small white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, orange peel, pine, and grass fill the nose.  Taste is nice blend of citrus, floral grassy notes, hint of caramel malt, and palatable bitterness.  Nice mouthfeel with lingering flavors after a smooth finish.

Thanks turdferguson for sharing, growler from the brewery.  Pours a slightly cloudy orange amber.  Nose is boss-ome,  extremely fresh and pure hop character.  Seans brews have a very definitive hop character in that they smell more similar to raw hops than any other beer Ive had.  Very leafy/green hop character with some citrus resin and mango.  There are no off characters whatsoever here.  Very very very slight onion/garlic quality, like I get with Summit sometimes.  Cant take my face out of this beer, better taste it now... Ohhhh....good.  Very very light balancing bready character with a grassy bitterness and rockin citrus rind character.  Medium bodied and dry on the finish. Lots of green hop character (green like whole hop, not like young).

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Re-rate at TJs. Pale orange-yellow body, moderate sized white head.  Aroma is full of grapefruit, pine and resin.  Pale malts sneak on through in the nose as well.  Flavor is similar with a bit more oomph.  Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, mild bitterness in the finish.  .
Swing top to snifter. Looks good; opaque-orange with nice lacing. Smells good too; pleasantly hopped. Tastes solid; good body and balance for the style. Pleasant on the palate too. Good stuff.

Big thanks for this treasure! Hazy light orange pour with a small white head that lingers as a film. Nose is fresh flowers, citrus, pines, tropical fruits, peaches and light caramel malts. Flavor is intense citrus, light pines, tropical fruits, some green grassy notes and finishes dry on the palate given some caramel flavors. LIght carbonation and moderately light mouthfeel. This was quite the nice pale ale. Among the best I have had in the style.

750 ml growler fill at HF.  Pours golden with white head.  Aroma of piney hops, some dankness.  Taste brings some citrus and pine hoppiness.  Its tremendously easy to drink.  For whatever reason this time around, the palate isnt doing it for me as much as previously.  Its not as crisp as Id like it; I blame that on my apartment being 84 degrees at the moment.  Finish is lingering bitter, and maybe a little yeasty.  If I had this around regularly, Id be a damn happy man.  Cant wait to get back to Hill Farmstead, or find it again on tap here in the city.

Tastes straw-like, pale ale, murky with alright tracing. Blond colour. Nice strong hops. Doesnt smell at first but hops hit you hard after.  Good profile with a really good farmy aftertaste, as you make expect. I dont taste the Hill, however. Lots of character in this one, certainly among the better Ive had for the style. On tap at the Farmhouse Tap and Grill.

Rattle n Hum Draft. Pours hazy orange yellow. Well Laced. Big aromas of grapefruit citrus and light malt grain. Well balaced pale body with a generous bitterness which lingers well through the finish. A hop heads delight.

Served in a goblet at Canal St.

Pours a radiant, chilled peachy apricot color with a thick cream colored head. Excellent retention, the head never quite fades away and leaves behind thick, sticky rings of lace.

Aroma is fresh and abundantly hoppy. Bitter grapefruit rind and pine with subtle tropical fruit sweetness. 

Body is medium thick and chewy with in your face carbonation. Flavor is ridiculously hoppy and rich for a 5% APA. Like the nose, grapefruit and pine hops, resiny and bitter, dominate from start to finish. There is a slight bready malt present and some sweet tropical fruits as the beer warms, but the hops are what linger well into the finish. Incredible flavor and hop presence for what is expected to be a mild APA.

Unfiltered almost chewy at times. This beer should be available every where. Brewers could learn a thing or two. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml growler from the Farmstead. A light orange brew with a loose lacey head. Aroma of pine and burnt rubber. Flavor is very fresh. Mouthfeel is refreshing at first, but more bittering and heavy with each sip. Very filling, actually. Long, lingering hoppy bitterness. Some bread. This is overall very good, but I preferred "What is Enlightenment?" better.

750ml poured at brewery. Pours a nice nice golden hue with a one finger head of white foam. Great hop aromas of earthy pine and hint of citrus.  Flavors are so well balanced and move through notes of ripe citrus and grapefruit with hints of floral... mmm and a great bitter clean finish !
Growler from Capones. Pours gold with thin white head. Aroma is citrus (mainly lemon) and some floral. Flavor is straw and lemon. Delicious.

Draft at Alla Spina.  Tulip glass.  Pours a hazy light amber-orange color with thick foamy off-white head.  The aroma of grass, pine and citrus.  Taste of citrus, sweet malt with a very solid hop bitterness.  One of the finest pale ales Ive tasted.

Big thanks to Kan for the share.  My first Hill Farmstead beer!  Pours a hazy straw yellow.  Aroma is lemon and orange, tastes follows suit, big lemon, just enough malt to balance it out, very pungent dry hops on the finish, leaves you wanting more.  Very refreshing and focused, this beer is all about the hops.

750 ml fliptop shared by Kan. Thanks, man! Pours a hazy golden pour, still glowing and a bit sunfire hued. A frothy brighter white head sits atop, dies down to a ring and laces ok. Aromas are lively mixes of citrusy hops, grapefruit and lemons stand out, pushing into fresh cut grass, florals, and some piney resinous qualities. Firm and dry. touches of bready malt might peek at times. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, offering a lively dry citrusy hopping up front. Lemon push the agenda, some grapefruit and oranges. Florals and dry earthy bitterness come in. Some pale malts, good piney resinous hops kinda seal the deal into the back end leaving a strong dry hoppy element, citrus and earthy hops mixing liberally. Well done.
Thanks Kan, pours hazed golden with white head. Aroma has citrus, lemons, and pine. Flavors have good bitterness, citrus and lemon rind. Dry finish, real tasty.

Tasted from the tap at the brewery. Clear golden brew with a white head. A mix of citrus and earthy pine on the nose. Flavors of fresh lemon, grapefruit and clean hops. Nice and dry with a background sweet malt character. Fantastic pale ale.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany!), pours an opaque bright orange with a medium white head. Aroma of fresh floral and piney hops, lots of caramel malt. Flavour is very dry and florally, with floral hops, pine tree, dry biscuity / doughy malt, and some soapy notes. Finishes really dry and hoppy. Extremely full-bodied for a 5% pale ale. Could drink liters and liters of this. Most excellent.

On tap at the Farmhouse Tap & Grill in Burlington, VT. Pours a cloudy orange colored body with a finger-width, frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is big florals and citruses with some apricots, grapefruit pines, and a touch of dank hops. A pale malt backing with a hint of caramel. Flavor is similar. Lots of fresh floral and piney citruses up front with some apricots, peach, and grapefruits. A bit of a dry, bready malt backing before this finishes very dry with some grassy pines and citruses that leave a medium-light bitterness. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium-light body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a really nice, fresh, easy drinking pale ale. Plenty of floral citruses and pines with some other fruits and a light malt backing. Solid.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 Complete re-rate after drinking it on tap @  multiple occasions. Hazy orange with a  small off-white head and good lacing.
